question: Who was the first victim of the policy of subsidiary alliance of Wellesley?
explanation:
The Nizam of Hyderabad was the first victim of the policy of subsidiary alliance of Lord Wellesley. The excerpts of the features
of subsidiary alliance are:
a) Any state which entered into this alliance had to give money or some territory for maintenance of British forces in the state.
b) Any Indian ruler would not enter into any further alliance with any other power nor would he declare war against any power
without the permission of the British.
c) The Indian ruler would not employ any Europeans other than the British.
d) The Indian ruler would acknowledge the British East India Company as the supreme power in India.
e) The ruler would allow British resident to stay in the state.
f) In case of conflict, the ruler would have to agree on the decision of British.
